intro: Barbosella prorepens, commonly known as the creeping barbosella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or violet in color, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Barbosella prorepens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
